snippet: The college in the Adirondacks, in order to accept a potential $20 million donation from Joan Weill, had asked to be released from a naming restriction put in place at the time of its founding.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and KRISTIN HUSSEY

abstract: Justice John T Ellis of State Supreme Court in Franklin County  rejects philanthropist Joan Weill's demand to rename Paul Smith's College in her honor in exchange for $20 million gift, putting school at center of growing debate over founding restrictions; ruling states money does not allow school to violate provision in founder Paul Smith's will that college retain original name in perpetuity.
lead_paragraph: The college in the Adirondacks, in order to accept a potential $20 million donation from Joan Weill, had asked to be released from a naming restriction put in place at the time of its founding.

headline.print_headline: 20 Million Reasons to Rename College, Rejected
headline.main: Judge Rejects Request by Paul Smith’s College to Change Its Name
